title: Executive Order 8909-Authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury To Permit the Entry of Bonafide Samples of Coffee Without Regard to Quota Restrictions
content: By virtue of the authority vested In me by section 2 of the joint resolution of Congress approved April 11, 1941 (Public Law 33, 77th Cong.), I hereby authorize the Secretary of the Treasury, under such conditions as he may prescribe, to permit the entry into the United States of bona-fide samples of coffee for testing purposes without regard to the quota restrictions provided for in the Inter-American Coffee Agreement.
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 8909-Authorizing the Secretary of the Treasury To Permit the Entry of Bonafide Samples of Coffee Without Regard to Quota Restrictions Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/372198
